question: Question_02_(b)
statement: Determine whether 2821 is a Carmichael number. Explain your answer.
sols:
We follow the hints above (especially hint 2) which suggests we should
use Korselt's Criterion. We first factor the number as

$\displaystyle 2821 = 7 \cdot 403 = 7 \cdot 13 \cdot 31$

We check that $\displaystyle (p-1) \mid (n-1)$ for each prime factor.
Notice that

\begin{align*}
(7-1) = 6 &\mid 2820\\
(13-1) = 12 &\mid 2820 \\
(31-1) = 30 &\mid 2820\end{align*}

We can see these are true by factoring

$\displaystyle 2820 = 10\cdot 282 = 2\cdot 5 \cdot 2 \cdot 141 = 2^{2} \cdot 5 \cdot 3 \cdot 47 = 2^{2} \cdot 3 \cdot 5 \cdot 47$.

Hence 2821 is a Carmichael number.
hints:
A Carmichael number is a composite number \emph{n} which satisfies

$\displaystyle b^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}$

for all integers with $\displaystyle \gcd(b,n) = 1$.

Recall Korselt's criterion which states that a positive composite
integer \emph{n} is a Carmichael number if and only if \emph{n} is
square free and for all prime divisors \emph{p} of \emph{n}, it is true
that $\displaystyle (p-1) \mid (n-1)$
